task.title: Customizing the Main CSS of a Document Type

taskbody.context:
The easiest way to customize the main CSS stylesheet of a document type is to create a new CSS stylesheet, save it in the same folder as the other main CSS files for that particular document type, and then select it from the Styles drop-down menu in Author mode.
For example, suppose that you want to customize the main CSS for DITA documents. To do this, follow these steps:

step.cmd: First, create a new CSS stylesheet and save it in the folder [OXYGEN_DIR]/frameworks/dita/css_classed (where the default main stylesheet named dita.css is located).

To add the new stylesheet as a main CSS stylesheet for DITA documents, and go to Document Type Association . Select the DITA document type and press the Edit button. Then, go to the CSS subtab of the Author tab.

fig.title: CSS Subtab of the Document Type Association Author Tab

step.cmd: Click the Add button to open a dialog box that allows you to specify the URI and Title for your newly created stylesheet. Leave the Alternate option unchecked to define it as a main stylesheet.
Press OK in all the dialog boxes to validate the changes.
Select your newly created CSS stylesheet from the Styles drop-down menu on the toolbar in Author mode.
step.stepresult: You can now edit DITA documents based on the new CSS stylesheet. You can also edit the new CSS stylesheet itself and see its effects on rendering DITA documents in the Author mode by using the Refresh action that is available on the Author toolbar and in the DITA menu.
